Stem: Wiry, with short hooked spines to 5 mm. Short, green shoots form pseudo-leaves (cladodes) replacing true leaves.
Leaves: Reduced, scale-like, replaced by very narrow shoots 4-5 mm long, naked, in dense clusters of 8-15.
Flowers: Solitary or in pairs, greenish to white, with six tepals 3-4 mm long, stalked 1-2.5 mm.
FruitSeeds: Blackish, spherical berry 4-5 mm across, with single seed.
DistinguishingFeatures: Blackish berries. Pseudo-leaves clustered as in *Asparagus africanus* but shorter.
